response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a node in a json file: I have a json file like this:
{
"name": "John",
"age": 25,
"address": {
"street": "12345",
"city": "New York",
"state": "NY",
"zip": "12345"
}
}
I want to get the value of the address.city. I tried this:
JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String city = jsonObject.getString("address.city");
But it doesn't work.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
